set:

You left behind a broken doll.
Clifford Harris, "A Broken Doll"

name: Enforcer
set:
Fire can soften iron.
Nkundo-Mongo proverb

set:
Perhaps to our senses things offer only their rejections. Perfume is what the flowers throw away.

Anonymous Malkavian, Das Buch von der Grabkrieg

In the name of the Eldest, I reclaim that which is rightfully his.

name: Eyes of Chaos

We live in a rainbow of chaos.

D.H. Lawrence, "Elysium"

name: Eyes of the Night

The night has a thousand eyes,

You are eternity's hostage,
a captive of time.

Leadership is an action, not a position.

He... remarked that the smuts in London were not so bad as they used to be when he was a student there.

A little unusual ammo can make all the difference when fighting Donal.

Our kind is unable to look upon the sun, for such is the Curse of Cagn.

a gleam of light passes.

Illusion is the first appearance of Truth.

Collective crimes incriminate no one.

And catching sight of us, he bit himself,

Wild Ones will hunt vampires even in their strongest cities.

Noblesse oblige.

Demon or bird! (said the boy's soul)

Path of Evil Revelations

name: Path of the Feral Heart, The

Patrol

name: Poison Pill
set:
It's your call. You do understand that if this goes sour, I'm going to be the one howling loudest for your head, right?
Jenna Cross, thin-blood

name: Political Antagonist
set:
He that wrestles with us strengthens our nerves and sharpens our skill.
Our antagonist is our helper.
Burke, "Reflections on the Revolution in France"

name: Possession
set:
My name is Legion; for we are many.
Mark 5:9 (NRSV)

name: Power Structure
set:
All political structure is based on power.
Weber, "Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft"

name: Praxis Seizure: London
set:
This was the being I was helping transfer to London where he might... create a new and ever-widening circle of semi demons...
Bram Stoker, "Dracula"

name: Praxis Solomon
set:
And the king said, "Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other."
1 Kings 3:25 (KJV)

name: Precognition
set:
"It's a poor sort of memory that only works backwards," the Queen remarked.
Lewis Carroll, "Through the Looking Glass"

name: Principia Discordia
set:
I am chaos. I am alive, and I tell you that you are free.
Principia Discordia

name: Priority Shift
set:
Did it ever occur to you that I might not want archons crawling all over this?
Hardestadt, Ventrue

name: Private Audience
set:
What we decide is what happens. The rest is mere shadowplay, a puppet show.
Francisco Domingo de Polonia, Lasombra

name: Procurer
set:
Bring me blood! Blood! Give it to me!
Sascha Vykos, Tzimisce

name: Project
set: YOUR CONVICTION WILL WALK BEFORE YOU.

name: Projectile
set: Talley tsked. He placed the pebble in the palm of his left hand and squinted, making sure that his aim was true. Lifting his hand, he concentrated for a second and then flicked the pebble right at the center of the Nosferatu's misshapen back.

name: Propaganda
set:
If the facts say otherwise then the facts must be altered.
George Orwell, "1984"

name: Pseudo-Blindness
Psychic Projection
set:
Darkness and glory rejoicingly blending,
Earth rising to heaven and heaven descending...
Emily Brontë, "High-Waving Heather"

name: Psychic Veil
set:
...didst enter, wildly dancing, through
The doorways of my sense unlatched
To make my spirit thy domain...
Baudelaire, "The Vampire"

name: Pulling Strings
set:
Pull the strings! Pull the strings!
The Puppetmaster, "Glen or Glenda?"

name: Pursuit
set:
What mad pursuit?
What struggle to escape?
John Keats, "Ode on a Grecian Urn"

name: Pushing the Limit
set:
These are our realms, no limit to their sway...
Lord Byron, "The Corsair"

name: Quick Jab
set:
Well, I grew up quick and I grew up mean,
My fists got hard and my wits got keen.
Shel Silverstein, "A Boy Named Sue"

name: Quick Meld
set:
So let us melt, and make no noise...
John Donne, "A Valediction Forbidding Mourning"

name: Quicken Sight
set:
So scented the grim Feature, and upturn'd
His nostril wide into the murky air,
Sagacious of his quarry from so far.
John Milton, "Paradise Lost"

name: Quickness
set:
There is no secrecy comparable to celerity.
Francis Bacon, "Of Delays"

name: Rabble Razing
set:
You are beyond my control. You are a burden on my will.
Hesha Ruhadze

name: Random Patterns
set:
Knowledge is more than equivalent to force.
Samuel Johnson, "Rasselas"

name: Rant!
set:
We are those who do not let others lead for us; we do not let others go where we will not lead ourselves.
Salvador Garcia, Brujah anarch

name: Rapid Change
set:
Our nature lies in movement; absolute rest is death.
Blaise Pascal

name: Rapid Thought
set:
To know and to act are one and the same.
Samurai maxim

name: Raptor
set:
If you face more than a couple, you've got real trouble. Lambach and his flock held a pack of us at bay for months.
Gangrel, Worcester 2002 Storyline

name: Rastacourere
set:
The fat and the strong I will destroy. I will feed them with justice.
Ezekiel 34:16 (NRSV)

name: Ravnos Acceptance
set:
Sometimes at that moment a wave of light breaks into our darkness, and it is as though a voice were saying: "You are accepted."
Paul Johannes Tillich, "The Shaking of the Foundations"

name: Rayzeel's Song
set:
The song was originally intended to ease pain. We've refined that idea to make the tune more potent, even addictive.
Wolf Valentine, Salubri antitribu

name: Razor Bat
set:
But as I approached the window, this... winged rat erupted in a tempest of chittering and flapping, alerting the Tremere and scratching at my back.
Christanius Lionel, Nosferatu antitribu

name: Read Intentions
set:
I may gain more knowledge out of the folly of this madman than I shall from the teaching of the most wise.
Bram Stoker, "Dracula"

name: Read the Winds
set:
No surprises anymore. The night has a thousand eyes, and I've had a thousand nights.
Stravinsky, Tzimisce Archbishop of Mexico City

name: Realm of the Black Sun, The
Rebel
set:
She knows I been fighting the Camaretards a long time and know how to do it.
Jack Drake, Brujah Anarch

name: Recruiting Party
set:
How fast has brother followed brother,
From sunshine to sunless land!
William Wordsworth, "Extempore Effusion Upon the Death of James Hogg"

name: Recruitment
set:
Follow me and I shall show you the way to victory.
Aurora Van Brande, Paladin, Lasombra

name: Recure of the Homeland
set:
Earth helped him with the cry of blood.
Sir John Beaumont, "Battle of Bosworth Field"

name: Recurring Contemplation
set:
Never mistake motion for action.
Ernest Hemingway

name: Red Herring
set:
In some cases — very many, it seems — illusion was quite preferable to reality.
Victoria Ash

name: Reform Body
set:
O! that this too, too solid flesh would melt...
William Shakespeare, "Hamlet", act I, scene 2

name: Regenerative Blood
set: Though their flesh appears weak and withered, their blood is strong. The Stiffs heal much faster than other Cainites.

name: Release of the Shackled Soul
set:
Self is the only prison that can ever bind the soul.
Henry Van Dyke, "The Prison and the Angel"

name: Respire
set:
Manipulation is a double-edged sword.
William "Violin99" Hannon, Hermit

name: Resplendent Protector
set:
Graunt that no Hobgoblins fright me,
No hungrie devils rise up and bite me.
John Day, 17th c. prayer

name: Restoration
set:
Drive my dead thoughts over the universe,
Like wither'd leaves, to quicken a new birth!
Percy Bysshe Shelley, "Ode to the West Wind"

name: Reversal of Fortunes
set:
O Fortune, you are like the moon: ever waxing and waning.
Carl Orff, "Carmina Burana"

name: Rewilding
set:
Cities and Thrones and Powers,
Stand in Time's eye,
Almost as long as flowers,
Which daily die
Rudyard Kipling, "Puck of Pook's Hill"

name: Ritual Challenge
set:
The teeth that bite to bitterness are sheathed in truth.
William Everson, "The Poet is Dead"

name: Rom Gypsy
set:
The dark-eyed ancient tribe that never rests
Took up the age-old journey yesterday...
Baudelaire, "Gypsies on the Road"

name: Rooftop Shadow
set:
Just follow. If you can't see, listen. If you can't hear, feel.
Philip Pullman, "The Amber Spyglass"

name: Roundhouse
set:
The Anarchs are wusses, but you get enough of them in one room and they think they can take on anyone.
Tyrus, Gangrel Archon

name: Ruins of Villers Abbey, Belgium
set:
Under heavy loads of trampled clay,
Lie bodies of the vampires full of blood;
Their shrouds are bloody, and their lips are wet.
Yeats, "Oil and Blood"

name: Rumor Mill, Tabloid Newspaper, The
set:
Rumor: the oldest media in the world.
Jean-François Revel

name: Sacrament of Carnage
set:
The spiritual value of a sacrament is like light -- although it passes among the impure, it is not polluted.
Saint Augustine, "Works", vol. 3

name: Sacré-Cœur Cathedral, France
set:
When the death agony of our cathedrals has been accomplished, our country will be transformed, dishonored.
Auguste Rodin, "Cathedrals of France"

name: San Lorenzo de El Escorial, Spain
Save Face
set:
Better that we should die fighting than be outraged and dishonored. Better to die than to live in slavery.
Emmeline Pankhurst

name: Scattershot
set: Tara fired once, blindly, over the table and into the doorway. Her objective wasn't actually to hit anyone (though she certainly wouldn't mind), but to keep the thin-bloods back for another moment.

name: Scouting Mission
set:
It's amazing how trusting these Camarilla bastards can be.
Jimmy Dunn

name: Screw the Masquerade!
set:
The Masquerade is unraveling as the mysticism of the mortals increases.
V.T., Vampire: The Masquerade

name: Second Tradition: Domain
set: None may challenge thy word while in thy domain.

name: Seduction
set:
Letting go is the secret; giving up to me is the greatest pleasure of all...
Robbi Sommers, Lilith

name: Sense Vitality
set:
It's not death if you refuse it. It is if you accept it.
James O'Barr, "The Crow"

name: Sensory Overload
set:
I have said that Danforth refused to tell me what final horror had made him scream out so insanely...
H.P. Lovecraft, "At the Mountains of Madness"

name: Servitor of Irad
set:
There will come a time when an Elder Darkness will stir deep below a city which has forgotten and will surprise the Elder, its children.
The Book of Nod

name: Shade
set:
Yet even your darkest shade a canvas forms
Whereon my eye must multiply in swarms
Familiar looks of shapes no longer there.
Charles Baudelaire, "Obsession"

name: Shadow Body
set:
The awful shadow of some unseen Power
Floats, tho' unseen, amongst us.
Percy Bysshe Shelley, "Hymn to Intellectual Beauty"

name: Shadow Play
set:
You will close your eyes,
in order not to see, through the glass,
The evening shadows making faces.
Arthur Rimbaud, "A Dream for Winter"

name: Shakar
set:
Ar-Rashid said, A true assassin has no ego, which is well, for he receives no glory.
The Admonitions

name: Shame
set:
All honor's wounds are self-inflicted.
Andrew Carnegie

name: Shanty Town Hunting Ground
set:
The desperate no longer care when death stalks their streets. Some think of it as a blessing.
Nigel the Shunned, Nosferatu antitribu

name: Sheepdog
set:
No more be griev'd at that which thou has done:
Roses have thorns, and silver fountains mud,
Clouds and eclipses stain both moon and sun,
And loathsome canker lives in sweetest bud.
Shakespeare, "Sonnet 35"

name: Shell Game
set: If you chase two rabbits, both will escape.

name: Shroud of Absence
set:
Oh! I didn't realize you had come in, Marconius. You catch the city sleeping, against its nature.
Andrea Giovanni

name: Shroud of Night
set:
The dragon-wing of night o'erspreads the earth.
William Shakespeare, "Troilus and Cressida", act V, scene 8

name: Sight Beyond Sight
set:
When you're as hunted as the few of us that remain are, you're either alert or you're dead. After a few decades of this, complete knowledge of one's surroundings becomes instinctive.
Miriam Benyona, Salubri

name: Sires Command, Childer Inherit
set:
An egg never sits on a hen.
Kiswahili proverb

name: Sixth Tradition: Destruction
set: Thou art forbidden to destroy another of thy kind.

name: Skin of Night
set:
I ask of Thee, beloved Night --
Swift be thine approaching flight.
Percy Bysshe Shelley, "To Night"

name: Skin of Rock
set:
Crushers of helpless misery,
Crushing down Justice, honoring Wrong:
If that be feeble, this be strong.
Emily Bronte, "Last Lines"

name: Skin of Steel
set:
...no sword on earth,
not the truest steel, could touch their assailant;
for by a spell he had dispossessed all
blades of their bite on him.
"Beowulf", 8th c. epic poem

name: Slaughterhouse, The
set:
Death and decay. Decay and death. But the soul survives, even in our inhuman shells. Comprehending the passage of the soul through the physical cycle requires accelerating the process whenever possible.
Anisa Marianna Lopez, Harbinger of Skulls

name: Sleep of Reason
set:
We're all in our own personal traps. We scratch and claw, but only at the air.
Norman Bates, "Psycho"

name: Slow Withering, The
set:
It's only a question of time before the withering hits me, and hard.
Beckett, Gangrel

name: Smite
set:
Above all, remember that you are too close if you can see into the monster's eyes. They can do things with their eyes.
Joshua "God45" Matthews, Wayward

name: Sniper Rifle
set:
Weapons are tools of ill omen.
Sun Tzu, "The Art of War"

name: Soak
set: The wounds he'd suffered would definitely have killed a mortal and would have destroyed many a Kindred. Jan had only the blood of Hardestadt and the elders of Clan Ventrue to thank that he'd survived this long.

name: Soar
set:
The higher we soar, the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly.
Friedrich Nietzsche

name: Social Charm
set:
Charming people live up to the very edge of their charm and behave just as outrageously as the world will let them.
Logan Pearsall Smith, "Afterthoughts"

name: Society Hunting Ground
set: The Toreador are imprisoned by their lust for the night life. Like a siren, it beckons them with promises of forbidden pleasures.

name: Sociopath
set:
When he is best, he is little worse than a man,
and when he is worst, he is little better than a beast.
William Shakespeare, "The Merchant of Venice", act I, scene 2

name: Sonar
set:
O dark dark dark. They all go into the dark.
T.S. Eliot, "East Coker"

name: Song in the Dark
set:
I heard the most bewitchingly beautiful voice from the shadows that night.
Lolita, Toreador antitribu

name: Soul of the Earth
set:
This ritual will cushion the creature's mind and body against the shock of your embrace.
Rebekka, Tremere Chantry Elder

name: Sowing Dissension
set:
Hey, the anarchs rule! They are way cool, and they are gonna rock this city down! I'm joinin' tomorrow man! You wanna come?
Todd, Caitiff

name: Speak with Spirits
set:
A dead little bird told me.
Cynthia Ingold, Ahrimane

name: Spectral Divination
set:
My locks are uncurled with dripping, drenching dew.
You know the old, whilst I know the new:
But tomorrow, you shall know this too.
Christina Rossetti, "The Poor Ghost"

name: Spirit's Touch
set:
We are eternal; and to us, the past
Is, as the future, present.
Lord Byron, "Manfred", act I, scene 1

name: Spiritual Intervention
set:
I call the phantoms of a thousand hours
Each from his voiceless grave.
Percy Bysshe Shelley, "Hymn to Intellectual Beauty"

name: Spying Mission
set:
I meet my shadow in the deepening shade...
Theodore Roethke, "In a Dark Time"

name: Staredown
set:
Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear -- not absence of fear.
Mark Twain

name: Starvation of Marena
set:
I am the vengeance of the Lord and of the Sword of Caine, and I say unto thee, thou art twice damned!
Righteous Endeavor, Tzimisce priest

name: Stealing Years
set:
What's blood for, if not for shedding?
Clive Barker and Bernard Rose, "Candyman"

name: Steam Tunnels
set:
I told myself that the owners of those voices faced the same obstacles that I did -- dangerous footing, complete darkness, terrific heat -- but I knew that I was probably deluding myself.
William Dear, "The Dungeon Master"

name: Stiff Contempt
set:
Horrid, repulsive and coarse. Someone should do something about them.
Victoria Ash, Toreador primogen

name: Stone Dog
set:
Be on your guard against a silent dog and still water.
Latin proverb

name: Stone Quills
set:
A porcupine would die of envy upon witnessing the carnage that erupted from the stone beast's hands.
Javier Montoya, Tremere

name: Stone Travel
set:
Half a hole is more than enough.
Bartholomew, Kiasyd

name: Stonestrength
set:
What does not destroy me, makes me stronger.
Friedrich Nietzsche, "The Twilight of the Idols"

name: Storm Sewers
set:
Lakes that endlessly outspread
Their lone waters, lone and dead,
Their still waters, still and chilly
With the snows of the lolling lily.
Edgar Allan Poe, "Dream-Land"

name: Stranger Among Us, The
set:
Having unexpected guests, especially of such outlandish nature, can ruin the whole night, but it often brings the best opportunities if one can meet the challenge.
Victoria Ash, Toreador Primogen

name: Strength of the Bear
set:
Where I come from, the law of the land is survival of the strongest.
Nettie Hale, Ahrimane

name: Strike with Conviction
set: BREAK ITS STRANGLEHOLD

name: Stutter-Step
set:
It is better to have less thunder in the mouth and more lightning in the hand.
General Ben Chidlaw

name: Succulent Vitae
set:
It will have blood; they say, blood will have blood.
William Shakespeare, "Macbeth", act III, scene 4

name: Sudario Refraction
set: Ambrogino looked to the mirror. No doubt someone — something — else saw the same reflection from the other side of the polished glass.

name: Sunset Strip, Hollywood
set:
They had no fear of the dark, for here the sun shone so brightly that it lit up their hearts at night.
Salvador Garcia, Brujah anarch

name: Surprise Influence
set:
Influence is neither good nor bad in an absolute manner, but only in relation to the one who experiences it.
André Gide

name: Svadharma
set:
Whatever Khalil told you was a lie... He doesn't care about anyone. He uses... people, things... He always gets what he wants...
Elizabeth Dimitros, Follower of Set

name: Swallowed by the Night
set:
To perish rather, swallowed up and lost
In the wide womb of uncreated Night?
John Milton, "Paradise Lost"

name: Swiftness of the Stag
set:
She hissed and fled. She scarcely seemed to touch the ground as she bounded away. I tried to track her but could find no print or broken twig to follow.
Luther, Gangrel antitribu

name: Swoop
set: As the Nosferatu howled in fury, Ferox swooped down again and crushed his ribcage. He stepped over the gurgling Sewer Rat and silently finished the job.

name: Sword of Judgment
set:
Justice is incidental to law and order.
J. Edgar Hoover

name: Tabriz Assembly
set:
Treat them as allies, but remember that the motivations of a snake are never truly known.
Nu, True Brujah, at the second 20th-century assembly.

name: Talons of the Dead
set:
Their fatal hands
No second stroke intend.
John Milton, "Paradise Lost"

name: Templar
set:
I don't have to kill anyone? Then why call for me?
Talley, The Hound, Lasombra

name: Temptation of Greater Power
set:
The Toreador's loyalty was easily won with cheap trinkets and even cheaper promises.
Gangrel, Newark 2002 Storyline

name: Tenebrous Form
set:
Be as a shadow on a dark night; unseen, unheard, let there be no sign of your coming in or going out.
The Admonitions

name: Tension in the Ranks
set:
Even the war ghouls look nervous.
Assamite, Seekonk 2002 Storyline.

name: Terrorists
set: In times of war, the laws are silent.

name: Theft of Vitae
set:
The blood is the life!
The blood is the life!
Bram Stoker, "Dracula"

name: Therbold Realty
set:
Money can't buy friends, but it can get you a better class of enemy.
Spike Milligan

name: Third Tradition: Progeny
set: Thou shalt only sire another with the permission of thine elder.

name: Thirst
set:
Night after night. Rising, hunting, killing, feeding. Nothing more than ambulatory corpses without the good sense to lie down and be still.
Felton, Tremere

name: Threats
set:
As by tenderness and ruth
Others rule thy life and youth,
I by terror choose to reign.
Charles Baudelaire, "The Revenant"

name: Thrones Crumble
set:
For there's no greater evil than a lack of leadership. That destroys whole cities, turns households into ruins, and in war makes soldiers break and run away.
Sophocles, "Antigon"

name: Thrown Gate
set:
Just be glad we aren't back in the days when most gates were made out of wood.
Angela Decker, Pander

name: Tongue of the Serpent
set:
No matter what he hope or plan,
There is no moment left when man
Is not subject to the constant
Warnings of this odious Serpent.
Charles Baudelaire, "The Serpent's Tooth"

name: Torment the Soul
set:
Suppose the yesterdays ate up our grand tomorrows?
If the old madness came this way?
Paul Verlaine, "Sagesse", Book One

name: Torpid Blood
set:
There is no after for us, and yet there is an after if kine survive.
Anonymous Malkavian, "Das Buch vom Grabkrieg"

name: Tortured Confession
set:
To chase one's victim, to prepare one's plan minutely, to slake an implacable vengeance, and then to go to bed... There is nothing sweeter in the world.
Josef Stalin

name: Tourette's Voice
set:
As we stand on the edge of darkness
Let our chant fill the void
That others may know ...
Tibetan Book of the Dead

name: Toy Chest Test
set:
Toy is a national treasure. We'd never let him go.
Preacher, Malkavian antitribu

name: Tradition Upheld
set:
The tradition finally becomes holy and inspires awe.
Friedrich Nietzsche, "Human, All Too Human"

name: Traditionalist
set:
We are stubborn, self-destructive conformists. Any other view of our species is just a self-congratulatory delusion.
Michael Crichton, "The Lost World"

name: Tranquility
set:
Enough! Be seated and be quiet, both of you.
Don Michael Antonio Giovanni, Giovanni "Prince" of Las Vegas

name: Tribute to the Master
set:
All these lives I will give you, ay, and many more and greater, through countless ages...
Bram Stoker, "Dracula"

name: Trophy: Clan Respect
set:
You solve this problem for me... and I will join my voice with yours when it comes time to formalize our new structure.
Hardestadt, Ventrue

name: Trophy: Discipline
set:
They taught you to hear them dead people? Think you could teach me?
Joe "Boot" Hill, Assamite antitribu

name: Trophy: Domain
set:
The Camarilla will formally acknowledge the supremacy of Clan Giovanni in Boston and its immediate environs.
Jacques Gauthier, Toreador

name: Trophy: Library
set:
The greatest university of all is a collection of books.
Thomas Carlyle

name: Trophy: Revered
set:
It is hard to free fools from the chains they revere.
Voltaire

name: Trophy: Safe Passage
set:
I want a promise that I won't be interfered with by the prince's sheriff.
Khalil Ravana, Ravnos

name: Truth of a Thousand Lies
set:
A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
Winston Churchill

name: Tutu the Doubly Evil One
type: tutu the doubly evil one (bane mummy)

name: Twisted Forest
set:
Now he goes along the darksome road,
Thither whence they say no one returns.
Catallus, "Carmina"

name: Uncontrolled Impulse
set:
I ran so fast that time and youth at last ran out,
I never stopped to think what life was all about,
And every conversation I can now recall,
Concerned itself with me, and nothing else at all
Charles Aznavour, "Yesterday, When I Was Young" (translated by Herbert Kretzmer)

name: Undead Persistence
set:
The cry is still, "They come!"
William Shakespeare, "Macbeth", act V, scene 5

name: Undead Strength
set:
Dead flesh isn't always subject to the mortal laws of physics.
Dodd, Brujah antitribu

name: Under the Skin
set:
The brain may devise laws for the blood, but a hot temper leaps o'er a cold decree.
William Shakespeare, "The Merchant of Venice", act I, scene 2

name: Unholy Penance
set:
Revenge is best served forever.
Setite parable

name: Unholy Radiance
set: Eze terrified both mortal and Laibon alike, for his unholy strength and overwhelming force of will.

name: Unity
set:
The time for our new world has begun.
Kim "Witness1" Sun, Visionary

name: Unmasking, The
set:
Those in the grip of panic have an unfortunate habit of disregarding our traditions of Masquerade.
Hardestadt, Ventrue

name: Unnatural Disaster
set:
I'm terribly sorry about the gas leak in the sewers. At least it's not combustible, right? Right?
Basil, Pander

name: Up Yours!
set:
Don't worry, I got my flamethrower back... eventually.
Jimmy Dunn, Pander

name: Urban Jungle
set:
If you want it you're gonna bleed
But it's the price you pay.
Guns N' Roses, "Welcome to the Jungle"

name: Using the Advantage
set:
This is a wise maxim: "...take warning from others of what may be to your own advantage."
Terence, "Heautontimoroumenos", act I, scene 2

name: Vanish from the Mind's Eye
set:
Night, voluptous and vast,
Arises, making hunger tame,
Hiding all things, even shame...
Charles Baudelaire, "The End of the Day"

name: Vendetta
set:
I will feed fat the ancient grudge I bear him.
William Shakespeare, "The Merchant of Venice", act I, scene 3

name: Venetian Conference
set:
For surely it is better to rule in the darkness than to humble myself falsely in the light.
Caine, from The Erciyes Fragments

name: Vengeance of Samiel
set:
Tonight, there would be a small measure of vengeance, one grain of sand to add to a desert that would in time stretch across the face of the Earth.
Parmenides, Assamite

name: Ventrue Headquarters
set: The Ventrue clan is organized much like a multinational corporation. Each major city has a meeting place where Ventrue may seek allegiance and obtain information.

name: Vermin Channel
set:
They fought the dogs and killed the cats,
And bit the babies in the cradles,
And ate the cheeses out of the vats,
And licked the soup from the cooks' own ladles.
Robert Browning, "The Pied Piper of Hamelin"

name: Vigil: The Thin Line
set:
We've probably all learned the ropes of the hunt here, but a few reminders are in order.
Jack "Hannibal137" Harmon, Defender

name: Vigilance
set:
The clearest eye is still blind when shut.
François "Warden" Loehr, Judge

name: Violation of Trust
set:
Your worst enemies are those whose faces are cheerful while their hearts are bitter.
Caecilius Statius, "Hypobolimæus"

name: Voice of Madness
set:
It is everything singing in my head at once.
Anatole, The Prophet of Gehenna, Malkavian

name: Vox Domini
set:
Are you going to force me to stop? We both know that you can. If you are my master, or speak on his behalf, you can make me do anything you want.
Lucita, Lasombra

name: Vulnerability
set:
Quentin fell into torpor after the encounter with Meshenka and has not been heard from since. A stronger power may have pulled him to Final Death.
Tzimisce, Dublin 2002 Storyline

name: Walk of Flame
set:
Now ye are flames, I'll tell you how to burn
And purge the ether of our enemies.
John Keats, "Hyperion"

name: Walk through Arcadia
set:
Those golden times
And those Arcadian scenes that Maro sings...
William Cowper, "The Winter Evening"

name: Wanderer's Counsel
set:
By coming and going will a bird weave its nest.
Ashanti proverb

name: Warning Sirens
set:
The storm is coming, he tells me.
Calebros, Nosferatu

name: Watch Commander
set:
One who is prepared and waits for the unprepared will be victorious.
Sun Tzu, "The Art of War"

name: Wave of Insanity
set:
To see clearly is poety, prophecy, and religion -- all in one.
John Ruskin

name: Well-Aimed Car
set:
We shall discuss your breach of the Masquerade later...
Tusk, The Talebearer, Nosferatu

name: Werewolf Pack
set:
Has the red wolf trotted east and east and east,
Far from the far, far other end of the day,
To fear a few fangs?
D.H. Lawrence, "The Red Wolf"

name: Whispers of the Nictuku
set:
And the bastard childer of Nosferatu still roam the dark places of the Earth hunting their favored cousins...
Tusk, The Talebearer, Nosferatu

name: White Phosphorus Grenade
set:
The sky is darkening like a stain;
Something is going to fall like rain,
And it won't be flowers.
W.H. Auden, "The Witnesses"

name: Winchester Mansion
set:
I am glad that it is old and big. I myself am of an old family, and to live in a new house would kill me.
Bram Stoker, "Dracula"

name: Wise Spider
set:
To travel is to see. To travel is to learn.
Hasani, Akunanse

name: Wolf Claws
set:
How cheerfully he seems to grin,
How neatly spread his claws...
Lewis Carroll, "Alice in Wonderland"

name: Wolf Companion
set:
It is you -- my equal, my companion and close friend.
Psalms 55:13 (NLT)

name: Zapaderin
set:
Belladonna, n. In Italian a beautiful lady; in English a deadly poison. A striking example of the essential identity of the two tongues.
Ambrose Bierce, "The Devil's Dictionary"

name: Zillah's Tears
set:
Caine's Promise is not intended for everyone, but only for his true childer, Zillah's childer, born of her tears.
Blackhorse Tanner, Ventrue antitribu

name: Zillah's Valley
set:
And each night, for three nights, Zillah drank from her Sire, though she did not know it. And, on the third night, Caine announced he would marry Zillah, his sweetest Childe, and she agreed.
The Book of Nod

name: Zip Line
set:
I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.
Dwight Eisenhower
